content: this pattern is also available for free on my blog here 1 learn how to do front post half_double_crochet stitches and get straight edges with this dishcloth pattern i became enamored by this stitch when i saw the bold chunky ridges in mama in a stitch s done in a day blanket pattern i d attempted to do an entire blanket in this stitch but as i worked my project began to turn into a rhombus when i d researched why this was happening most of the forum posts suggested a gauge problem not so this stitch simply slants as you work it so you need to combat the slanting by increasing on one side and decreasing on the other if you d like to learn how to get this great texture and want to practice this stitch a dishcloth is a great way to do so i hope you enjoy this fun quickie pattern abbreviations chain s chain s fphdc s front post half_double_crochet s half_double_crochet s half_double_crochet s hdc2tog half_double_crochet two together repeat repeat round s round s rs right side single_crochet s single_crochet s st s stitch es ws wrong side yo yarn over special stitch hdc2tog yo insert your hook in a st pull up a loop you should have 3 loops on your hook yo insert your hook in the next st pull up a loop you should have 5 loops on your hook yo and pull through all 5 loops materials lily sugar n cream weight 4 medium 100% cotton 120yd/109m 2 5oz/71g red 1 skein size h/8 5mm crochet hook scissors tapestry needle for weaving in ends finished size before border 5″ x 5″ | with border 5 5″ x 5 5″ gauge 16 sts x 15 row = 4″ x 4″ 1 https //dananield com/2024/07/26/front-post-half-double-crochet-dishcloth/
